str2: For. A primary particle; properly, assigning a reason.
And, both. A primary particle of connection or addition; both or also.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Active - Nominative Masculine Singular
str2: From hagios; to make holy, i.e. purify or consecrate; to venerate.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Middle or Passive - Nominative Masculine Plural
str2: From hagios; to make holy, i.e. purify or consecrate; to venerate.
All, the whole, every kind of. Including all the forms of declension; apparently a primary word; all, any, every, the whole.
From out, out from among, from, suggesting from the interior outwards. A primary preposition denoting origin, from, out.
One. (including the neuter Hen); a primary numeral; one.
A primary preposition denoting the channel of an act; through.

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Middle or Passive - 3rd Person Singular
str2: To be ashamed, be ashamed of. From epi and aischunomai; to feel shame for something.
(a) I call, summon, invite, (b) I call, name. Akin to the base of keleuo; to 'call'.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Accusative Masculine 3rd Person Plural
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.
A brother, member of the same religious community, especially a fellow-Christian. A brother near or remote.
